• Short Fiction, Poems

  • Hack, Visible Binary

    Drying was not an act of will but an act of environment, being at odds with it. We took to odds easily, not wanting damp hair or cold wind.

  • Slat, Bombay Gin: SLIT LOOM

    with K. Blasco Soler, after Mahmoud Darwish

  • She Did Not Sing, The Poetry Project

    Who can resist a good container? Outlined in silver, the naked couple held hands. A small vine climbed each leg. I thumbed over the pair of sloping shoulders, thick backs, and flat cheeks...

  • Visit to Makon, Wildness

    “We can never go back,” I said softly, offering her a mantra, an antidote for keeping memory at bay. Even now, I hold those words close to my body, low, against the liver...

  • Movement, Performance, Teaching

    11.14.24 - A sound and theater performance of Poupeh Missaghi’s Sound Museum (Coffee House Press 2024), a theory fiction, with Brian Alarcon, Valerie Hsiung and Neshat Sadatmansoori.

    Oct 2023 - May 2024

  • Projects

  • forthcoming abalone, Counterpath (2025)

    A poetry performance, object, and chapbook

  • Writing

  • finalist Night Laps, Wendy’s Subway

    2024 Open Reading Period, guest judged by Bhanu Kapil

  • finalist Squat Practice, Essay Press Chapbook

    An essay-poem collection on tropical fecundity and density as coverage.

Bo Hwang is an artist and writer working in poetry and movement. Recent works include: “abalone,” a poetry performance, object, and chapbook (forthcoming Counterpath 2025); Night Laps, a poetry book and finalist for Wendy's Subway's 2024 Open Reading, judged by Bhanu Kapil; and Squat Practice, an essay-poem collection on tropical fecundity and density as coverage, which was a finalist for the 2024 Essay Press Chapbook Contest.

@bohwang__
